author: Alex Richards
title: Ross McCormack trains again with Aston Villa's Under-23s as Steve Bruce looks to offload £12million misfit
text:
McCormack has scored just three times for Villa so far (Photo: Aston Villa FC   
Ross McCormack returned to training at Aston Villa on Monday, but was again with the club’s youth side. 
McCormack, who cost £12million last summer, looks to have little future at Villa Park under Steve Bruce, who went public with his criticism of the striker over the weekend. 
The 30-year-old has missed a number of training sessions recently, leaving Bruce furious. 
The senior side were given Monday off as a recovery day after the weekend draw with Preston, but McCormack was called in once more to train with the Under-23s - as he had last week, after being cast aside by Bruce. 
After the player's latest indiscretion - where McCormack claimed he couldn’t make training because his gates would not open - Bruce is looking for a buyer. McCormack has missed a number of training sessions (Photo: Aston Villa FC via Getty Images) Read More Aston Villa boss Steve Bruce opens up on AWOL Ross McCormack 
He said at the weekend: “In my opinion, he’s not fit enough to play unless his attitude and record of missing training improves 
“If he keeps missing training like he does – then that will be the situation. The latest excuse was that his gates had stuck but he couldn’t jump over a fence that was four feet six inches high. 
“There has been too much indiscipline at this club for way too long. Not in 20 years of management have I gone down this road of publicly shaming a player but I have to make a stand because I won’t put up with it. Not on my watch.” 
The Scot has scored just three times in 22 games since his arrival and has struggled for fitness this term, first under Roberto Di Matteo and now under Bruce. The Scot's impact has been minimal since his £12million arrival (Photo: BPI/REX/Shutterstock) Steve Bruce is looking to change the culture at Villa Park (Photo: Aston Villa FC/Getty Images) Read More Aston Villa boss Steve Bruce closing in on £5million Barnsley double swoop 
The Villa chief is unhappy at what he perceives as a lack of discipline running throughout the club, and is seeking to change the culture at Bodymoor Heath. 
Bruce is eager to sign Barnsley duo Conor Hourihane and James Bree, following up the £3million arrival of Henri Lansbury, as he seeks players hungry to learn and fire the club back into the Premier League. 
Offloading McCormack’s £45,000-plus wages and recouping a portion of the club’s initial outlay may prove difficult however, while the club also need to persuade the 30-year-old - who signed a four-year deal in the summer - that his future lies elsewhere. poll loading Will Aston Villa win promotion to the Premier League? 6000+ VOTES SO FAR
